content.description: Start with a high left hand on a great hold. Weird feet get you established, climb the bulge/slab up to the crack under the roof, Â get adventurous and take the crack up and left and top out or bail out right and descend down the crack until you can hop down where the tree used to be.
content.location: This is the obvious arete on the bigger of the two erratics.

content.description: Squat start on small, barely there crimps and a decent left foot, power up to the slopers, and ride the rail left to top out.
content.location: This is on the backside of the biggest boulder.

content.description:
Beta video - https://youtu.be/cS7ur4Keojw.

 Stand start in the middle of the wall with your right hand on a solid pinch and your left hand down a little with a small sidepull or undercling. Use a small left foothold to pull on, and move far left into 3 finger, iron cross style move. Move up and left to top out or go for the the extra challenge of the direct finish.

 I thought the crux was transferring weight left after landing the iron cross move.
content.location: Start 8 feet to the right of Autopsy.

content.description: Sit start with a low left hand pinch and a higher right hand crimpy pinch on the arete. Move left to a sidepull, and bump right hand up the arete several times to easier climbing.
content.location: With your back to the problem The Razor, this is the arete about 10-12 feet in front of you and slightly to your left.

content.description: This is essentially an extension into the problem Off the Grid. Start about 4-5 feet right of Off the Grid and make a couple of moves to join the start of Off the Grid. Start with a right crimp and a left crimpy pinchy hold on the arete. Move your left hand up the arete.
content.location: Start about 3-4 feet right of the problem Off the Grid.

content.description: This is the awkward arete that is located about 35 feet away and downhill from the Alcove boulder. Negotiate interesting sidepulls and gastons with awkward feet to gain the large crack below the small roof. Top out straight up or traverse the crack right and top out there.
content.location: This is on the bigger of the two erratics, you will see it.

content.description: Sit start just right of a giant pine tree with your left hand on a crimp and your right hand any place on the slopey arete. Move right and up to top out.
content.location: This ascends the steep. right-trending arete on the biggest boulder that faces the water.

content.description: This is the largest boulder in the boulder garden.
